channel.title: Dayton Ohio on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: The tremors come, the tremors go, they love the wintry weather: frost quakes in Ohio
item.description: The Dayton Daily News notes an overnight frost quake centered around Darke County, Ohio on February 10, 2011. The quake, or cryoseism as it’s known in scientific circles, occurs when moisture soaks into the soil and a quick freeze causes a sudden, even violent expansion and contraction. Darke County’s 911 director Brandon Redmond said the quakes erupted for eight hours Thursday, starting at 1 a.m. The heaviest reports were between 5:30-7:30 a.
